H0.text: One of the largest countries in Africa derived its food wealth for thousands of years from the regular flooding of which river. Congo River

H1.text: One of the largest countries in Africa derived its food wealth for thousands of years from the regular flooding of which river. Orange River

H2.text: One of the largest countries in Africa derived its food wealth for thousands of years from the regular flooding of which river. Zambezi River

H3.text: One of the largest countries in Africa derived its food wealth for thousands of years from the regular flooding of which river. Nile

A4.text: Because the river overflowed its banks annually and deposited new layers of silt, the surrounding land was very fertile.

A5.text: The Ancient Egyptians cultivated and traded wheat, flax, papyrus and other crops around the Nile.
